purpose: The code appears to be part of a malicious script that collects system information including package names, public and private IP addresses, and file contents, then sends this data via a Discord webhook.
flows: File contents from poc.txt -> Discord webhook
System information from command execution -> Discord webhook
Package name from package.json -> Discord webhook
IP addresses from system commands -> Discord webhook
anomalies: Execution of arbitrary system commands using child_process.exec
Reading of sensitive files like package.json and poc.txt
Sending of system information to external service without user consent
analysis: This code demonstrates a clear case of information disclosure through a Discord webhook. It gathers sensitive data including package name, system details, and IP addresses, then exfiltrates this information to a remote server. The presence of hardcoded credentials (webhook URL) and system command execution makes this particularly dangerous as it could enable unauthorized access or data theft.
conclusion: High risk security vulnerability detected. The code is designed to exfiltrate system information to a remote Discord webhook, constituting a serious security threat.
